speaker: Keynotes by Andrey Breslav & Erik Meijer
title: Kotlin Conference
description: Two days of content from Kotlin creators and community members

speaker: David Vávra
title: MobCon Europe
subject: From Firebase to UI with RxJava and Kotlin
description: Firebase Realtime Database is an awesome tool which solves offline and sync problems of your app. However, it requires flattening your data and your UI needs some bits from multiple Firebase paths. RxJava and Kotlin is ideal for this task. Online Rx examples are usually too simple – I will show you real-life examples which will help you understand the power of Rx.

speaker: Lieven Doclo
title: GeeCON 2017
subject: Implementing Clean Architecture using Kotlin
description: For those familiar with the teachings of Uncle Bob, Clean Architecture is no stranger. It's a set of architectural guidelines that provide a SOLID set of principes on which to base you architecture in order to have a clean, easy to understand and even easier to maintain foundation. This talk will show you how you can implement such an design, using Java, and will demonstrate the power of such a design. It will also show how you can be pragmatic in implementing Clean Architecture and what the possible implications can be when making pragmatic concessions.

speaker: James Avery & David Kilmer
title: Rochester Software Development Meetup
subject: How Kotlin Won Us Over
description: With 10 million lines of code in over 8000 OSS Github repositories, Kotlin has become a language worth looking into. In this talk James and David will give you a whirlwind tour of the most productivity-enhancing features of the language and show you how you can start to incorporate it painlessly into your own codebase. Along the way, you'll find out how our development team got addicted to Kotlin, and why it's now our default choice for new project.

speaker: Ítalo Maciel
title: GDG Recife
subject: #Hangout: Hello Kotlin! com Italo Marcel
description: Neste hangout você vai aprender por que e como você deve utilizar Kotlin nos seus projetos Android e aumentar sua produtividade.

speaker: Roland Berger
title: Java User Group Ch
subject: Einführung in Kotlin
description:
Kotlin soll zu hunderprozent kompatibel zu Java sein, läuft auf der JVM und bietet viele kleine, grosse, überraschende und erfrischende Erleichterungen gegenüber Java. Deswegen ist Kotlin für jeden Java Entwickler interessant.

Dass Kotlin ab der Version 1.1 auch zu JavaScript kompiliert werden kann, macht die Sprache nun auch für JavaScript Entwickler spannend.

Der Talk stellt die coolsten Kotlin Sprachfeatures vor.

Im zweiten Teil wird anhand eines REST Services auf Basis von Springboot gezeigt, dass die von JetBrains angepriesene 100% Kompatibilität zu Java kein Marketinggeschwafel ist.

Am Schluss gibt es ein Beispiel zur Kompilierung zu JavaScript.

speaker: Lucas Campos
title: GDG São Paulo
subject: Kotlin Interpolations
description: Kotlin

speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
title: Bydgoszcz Java User Group
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od ponad roku, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat… Jeśli dodać do tego fakt, że działa z Androidem out-of-the-box, oraz że zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, to robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

speaker: Singapore, Singapore
title: Grab Tech Thursdays
subject: Kotlin: A New Hope?
description: Introduction to Kotlin for Android developers

speaker: Bastien Ladron
title: Java User Group Luxembourg
subject: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a language running on JVM and developed since 2010 by JetBrains (IntelliJ, Webstorm, ...) in order to replace their own Java stack. They currently use it in production for some of your favorite IDEs! This language takes advantage of the experience of many other languages (Java, Scala, C #, Groovy, ...), and is intended to be a natural transition for Java developers by taking advantage of our experience on the Java ecosystem, being compatible with legacy stacks, and without having inertia of backward-compatibility decades to ensure. This talk will be shared between slides and code, with examples of Kotlin syntax, interoperability with Java and integration into a Spring-boot stack.

speaker: Abdulla Obaid
title: Android Developers Amsterdam
subject: Kotlin Development
description:
Kotlin is a brand-new, open-source programming language made by the smart people at JetBrains, the creators of IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio IDEs. Its been in development for around 6 years now. Kotlin introduces many improvements to Android development over Java including null-pointer safety, extension functions, clearer code structure, easier prototyping, and even 100% interoperability with Java.

In this talk, we will explore the following:

- Crash course on Kotlin

- Production-level Kotlin development

speaker: Alberto J Arias
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Functional programming with Kotlin
description: Let's learn together the basics of functional programming using Kotlin and illustrate the concepts with simple examples.

speaker: Andrzej Jóźwiak
title: IT Group in Łódź
subject: Kotlin dla programistów Android
description: Dla programistów systemu Android czas nieomalże się zatrzymał. Już niebawem pojawi się Java 9, niestety Android nierozerwalnie związany jest z archaiczną już Java 6. Programowanie funkcyjne, strumienie, wyrażenia lambda nie są domyślnie dostępne. By móc korzystać z idiomów programowania funkcyjnego, potrzebne są dodatkowe biblioteki, co w połączeniu z ekspresywnością języka Java daje nam często nadmiernie rozbudowany i nieczytelny kod. Odpowiedzią na te problemy może być język Kotlin. W trakcie prezentacji przyjrzymy się językowi Kotlin. Jakie najczęstsze bolączki jest w stanie rozwiązać? Czy i jaki narzut niesie wykorzystanie go w projekcie. Przyjrzymy się, jak wygląda wygenerowany kod na tle innych rozwiązań, takich jak Retrolambda czy Lombok oraz czy możliwe jest wykorzystanie języka Kotlin w projektach legacy.

speaker: Christoph Pickl
title: Kotlin Vienna
subject: What's new in Kotlin 1.1
description: Kotlin 1.1 has been released and has many exciting new features and improvements. Christoph will give a talk about the best new additions in Kotlin 1.1!

speaker: Andy Bowes
title: Kotlin Yorkshire Meetup Group
subject: Hands-on Kotlin - Learn some Kotlin by solving coding problems
description:
This meet up will be an opportunity to learn to program in Kotlin and to see first-hand the many features which make Kotlin such an interesting/exciting JVM language.

The evening will provide a range of problems which cover the key differences between Java & Kotlin and a range of difficulty so that there should be something to keep every bodies brain working.

speaker: Arold Ádám
title: HWSW free
subject: Kotlin - átállás tapasztalatok
description: Kotlin

speaker: Mohit Sarveiya
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Integrating GraphQL with Kotlin
description: GraphQL is a query language for APIs developed by Facebook. It allows you to retrieve only the data you need by sending a GraphQL query on the client side. In this talk, I will show you how you could integrate GraphQL with Kotlin on the server. I will demonstrate how to use the Java implementation of the GraphQL specifications with Kotlin extensions. Through examples, I will show the benefits of GraphQL versus a traditional REST API implementation.

speaker: Shubham Verma, Kunwar Jolly
title: Meetup at Daffodil Software
subject: Full day workshop on Kotlin April 29th, 2017.
description: Kotlin, the new programming language by JetBrains has taken the app development landscape by a storm. As a JVM language it is fairly easy to learn and a fun to work upon with some really helpful features like null-safe types. Today, Kotlin is an ideal option for developing large, complicated and performance-critical applications. Daffodil Software welcomes you to the next series of #MeetupAtDaffodil , featuring a full day workshop dedicated to Kotlin. Its an opportunity for you to diversify your skillset, interact with the skilled Kotlin community, learn best practices plus a lot more.Spanning over the entire day, the workshop is divided into two sessions covering the following topics.

speaker: Igor Buzatović
title: JavaCro'17 Conference
subject: Switching from Java to Kotlin
description: You want to do your everyday programming in modern language, that has nice functional programming features, that is less verbose and more concise than Java, but you don't want to give up on static type system and benefits that it provides?You want better language but you don't want to give up all java frameworks and libraries that you are using happily for years? A lot of different JVM languages emerged lately so there are many options, but if you want to switch from Java with minimum effort and risk, Kotlin is probably the best choice for you.

speaker: 小島領剣
title: D3＝Designer & Developer Division
subject: Android開発におけるScala, Kotlin, Java比較入門
description:
ついにインターネットに繋がるOSのNo.1はWindowsではなくなりAndroidになりました。 日本でもiPhoneの独裁政権は終焉を迎え、Android勢力の強みは増すばかりです。

でもAndroidエンジニアの供給が全然追いついてない。 そしていまだにJava6とか書かないといけないし。

Androidを始めてみたかったり、すでに作っていてもJava以外で書いてみたいという方も多いと思います。 そんな方向けに、ScalaとかKotlinとかでのAndroid開発をさらーっとおさらいします。

技術の深い話は期待しないでいただきたいですが、言語の違いは明確になるとは思います。

speaker: Armando Picón
title: Lima Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin for Android Developers
description: Hola a todos! Como les comenté tenemos la posibilidad de sortear la edición digital con derecho a actualizaciones del libro Kotlin for Android Developers

speaker: Thomas Girard
title: Open Source School Talks
subject: Kotlin — programming language for the JVM by JetBrains
description:
Créé par JetBrain, Kotlin est un langage pour la JVM 100% compatible et interopérable avec Java.

Thomas Girard vient nous présenter les fonctionnalités principales du langage lors d'un live coding intéractif.

Vous pourrez apprécier la simplicité, la puissance, mais aussi les gains de productivité, de sécurité et le plaisir d'utiliser Kotlin!

speaker: Ilya Zorin
title: Helsinki Android Meetup
subject: Introducing Kotlin into a production Android app
description: Introducing Kotlin into a production Android app (Ilya Zorin, Zalando)

speaker: Philipp Hauer
title: Clean Code Days 2017
subject: Cleaner Code with Kotlin
description: Die JVM-Sprache Kotlin ist Java deutlich überlegen. Sie vermeidet eine signifikante Menge an Boilerplate, verhindert gängige Fehler durch kluges Sprachdesign und ist obendrein auch noch besser lesbar. Zusätzlich ermutigen die Sprachkonstrukte den Entwickler zu einem besseren Softwaredesign. Das klingt doch alles sehr nach Clean Code! Tatsächlich ermöglicht es Kotlin, einfacher Clean Code zu schreiben. Oftmals geschieht dies fast wie von selbst. Aber Kotlin ist kein Allheilmittel. Der Entwickler ist am Ende immer noch selbst gefordert, die Prinzipien von Clean Code einzuhalten. In diesem Talk wird gezeigt, wie Kotlin dabei helfen kann, Clean Code zu schreiben und was es dabei zu beachten gibt.

speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
title: Android Makers Paris 2017
subject: Développez votre prochaine application avec Kotlin
description:
Kotlin est un langage développé par Jetbrains. Sa version 1.0 (production ready) est sortie en début d'année 2016, faisant un certain buzz au sein de la communauté Android. Aujourd'hui en version 1.0.6, et bientôt 1.1, Kotlin continue de susciter un vif intérêt.

Ce “nouveau“ langage est très clairement prisé, à juste titre, par la communauté android qui en est demandeuse. D'autres communautés Java, comme spring.io, s'ouvrent clairement et officiellement à ce langage.

À ekito, cela fait plus d'un an que nous travaillons sur ce langage et aujourd'hui, nous n'hésitons plus à lancer des applications en production avec Kotlin.

Cette session propose de découvrir ce langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts. Nous verrons comment Kotlin boost la productivité du développement d’applications Android et pourquoi vous ne pourrez plus vous en passer ;)

speaker: Željko Trogrlić
title: Java Talks 4
subject: Double feature: Kotlin - Why? and Kotlin Enterprise Edition
description: Experience language embraced by Android community and major players like Gradle and Spring. Find out how to write lean Java Enterprise Edition applications in Kotlin.

speaker: Kinoshita Yusaku
title: 日本Kotlinユーザグループ
subject: KotlinのLT会！Kotlin入門者の集い
description: Kotlin入門者のLT大会&懇親会です。 最近Kotlin始めた方、これからKotlinを深めていこうという方、ぜひ集まって「Kotlinのここがよかった」「ここが好きになった」「ここがひっかかりやすい」など、Kotlinを始めるにあたっての知識を共有しましょう。

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: Kotlin User Group Belgium
subject: Kotlin in Android
description: How to use Kotlin in Android, Coroutines, Kotlin 1.1

speaker: Akshay Chordiya
title: Pune Mobile Developers
subject: Kotlin-ize your Android Development
description:
Since Android took the world by storm, we have had no alternatives to Java for android app development. Although its usage is widespread, Java comes with a lot of historical baggage. Java 8 solved few of the language issues, but to use it a minimum SDK version of 24 is required

Kotlin aims to fill that gap of a missing modern language for the Android platform. Lets explore Kotlin for android app development in this meetup.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Genome Campus Software Craftsmanship Community
subject: Kotlin – Ready for production
description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

speaker: Jordan Beck
title: Brooklyn Kotlin Meetup
subject: Kotlin
description: about Kotlin

speaker: Patrick Cousins
title: Brooklyn Kotlin Meetup
subject: Kotlin
description: about Kotlin

speaker: Akshay Chordiya
title: Mumbai Android Developers Meetup
subject: Kotlin-ize your Android Development
description:
Since Android took the world by storm, we have had no alternatives to Java for android app development. Although its usage is widespread, Java comes with a lot of historical baggage. Java 8 solved few of the language issues, but to use it a minimum SDK version of 24 is required

Kotlin aims to fill that gap of a missing modern language for the Android platform. Lets explore Kotlin for android app development in this meetup.

speaker: Piet Pieterse
title: GDG The Dutch Android User Group
subject: Kotlin: Expectations vs Reality
description: We will be exploring the reasons why we adopted Kotlin, our expectations going in, our practical findings along the way, and the impact on our way of coding and the impact on the team.

speaker: Marc Moreno
title: Barcelona Android Developer Group
subject: Explotando delegados y extensiones en Kotlin
description: Con la idea de montar una serie sobre Kotlin, esta primera charla hablará sobre como explotar el potencial de los delegados y las extensiones en Kotlin, en base a diferentes aspectos del desarrollo Android, como por ejemplo la persistencia de datos, two-way binding con data binders o la creación de custom views.

speaker: Enrique López Mañas
title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
subject: Kotlin
description: talk about Kotlin

speaker: Takahiro Yamashita
title: Kotlinもくもく会
subject: プログラミング言語Kotlin
description: Android開発で注目されているプログラミング言語「Kotlin」をもくもく書いて勉強する会です。

speaker: Dean Gerber
title: CocoaHeads Johannesburg
subject: Kotlin and Swift
description: We want industrial-strength object-oriented languages, make it better than Java and Objective-C but still be fully interoperable. Make it compile fast! Must work on Android and IOS! Give us the ability to use prototype-inheritance (Extensions!). What about Swift? Is learning Kotlin enough to know Swift? Sounds too good to be true? Let’s explore the facts, the fiction, the future of Kotlin and Swift.

speaker: Giorgio Natili
title: MobileTea #11 - Tech TRILL
subject: Functional Reactive Programming with Kotlin
description: Reactive programming is a paradigm oriented around data flows and propagation of changes. Kotlin is a programming language intended to be a better Java, and it's designed to be usable and readable across large teams with skill and discipline variances. Despite its object-oriented building blocks, Kotlin fits well in the functional reactive programming landscape. In this essay, I will deep-dive into the most relevant aspects of FRP in Kotlin focusing on the advantages that everyone can get when using this approach to build an Android app.

speaker: 小林 大祐
title: サポーターズ勉強会
subject: 【学生＆若手エンジニア向け勉強会】ライブラリから始めるKotlin・Rx・DI入門
description:
今回のテーマは「ライブラリから始めるKotlin・Rx・DI入門」。

KotlinはJetBrainsが作った言語で2016年の2月にv1がリリースされました。

Null安全・拡張関数・関数リテラル等の魅力があり、正式リリース以降、

サーバやAndroidなどでの導入事例が増えてきています

今回はそのKotlinや、Retrofit2・RxJava2・Dagger2などのモダンなライブラリを用いて、

一通りの機能が揃ったアプリについて解説していきます。

speaker: Mike Buhot
title: Brisbane Kotlin User Group
subject: DSLs in Kotlin
description: Mike Buhot is going to take us through some DSL basics with Kotlin and the patterns he's used with eskotlin for Elasticsearch and kotlin-jpa-specification-dsl for JPA repositories.

speaker: Adam Erb
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: Kotlin workshop
description:
This time is not a presentation, it's something better. Using our laptops we want to follow a tutorial in the Kotlin language or simply experiment with the language (either using the REPL, or an IDE, or solving the Kotlin koans http://kotlinlang.org/docs/tutorials/)

Adam will be suggesting some tutorials that could be about Android development or back end development with Kotlin.

speaker: Yuko Gonokami etc.
title: 第5回Kotlin勉強会 ＠ Sansan
subject: Kotlin勉強会
description: 3/1にKotlin1.1リリースされました。Kotlin1.1リリース記念としてKotlin1.1 LT専用枠を設けました。 また、自由LT枠でもKotlin1.1に関する話題で応募していただいても構いません。

subject: Better Android Development with Kotlin and Gradle
description: In this talk, Ty will walk you through setting up and using Kotlin with Gradle to streamline your workflow for Android development, both within the build tool phase and within the application itself. After a brief overview of Kotlin, we’ll dive into how it can be used with Gradle to accelerate Android Development with a consistent language.

speaker: Travis Subannaphong
title: Droidcon Bangkok 2017
subject: Bacon Driven Development in Kotlin with Spek
description: Bacon Driven Development in Kotlin with Spek

speaker: Сергей Крюков
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group #3
subject: Kotlin & Spring 5
description:
Spring 5 – популярный фреймворк, выход которого запланирован уже этим летом.

В этой версии мы увидим новый реактивный подход к написанию приложений, а Kotlin-разработчиков может заинтересовать поддержка их любимого языка.

Сергей расскажет о поддержке Kotlin в Spring 5, а именно о:

Плагине kotlin-spring

Расширениях для GenericApplicationContext

Расширениях для RestTemplate

Встроенной поддержке nullable-типов

Применении Kotlin в MVC-шаблонах

Расширениях для Reactor

Kotlin DSL для WebFlux

speaker: Thiago Frederico Costa Porciúncula
title: The Developer's Conference
subject: Kotlin depois de 6 meses. É legal mesmo?
description: Kotlin is a programing language created by JetBrains that brings clarity, security, and simplicity to the code. In the last 6 months, we worked with this language developing an Android application. In this talk we'll give our opinion presenting the pros and cons of that experience.

speaker: John Childress
title: Houston Java Users Group
subject: Desktop Programming in Kotlin
description:
Kotlin is a statically typed language that targets the JVM and JavaScript developed by JetBrains.

Tornado FX is a small and light JavaFX Framework for the Kotlin programming language.

Come out for an introduction to Kotlin and TornadoFX. Learn how TornadoFX can help you build desktop applications on the JVM.

title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
subject: Kotlin
description:
20:15 Dmitry Jemerov

"State of the Union"

Overview of where things are with Kotlin now and where they're moving.

Dmitry is the author of the Kotlin in Action book and team lead in the Kotlin Tooling team at JetBrains.

20:45 Egor Andreevici

Unit Testing with Kotlin

Egor is an experienced Android developer, currently building a mobile messaging app at 1&1. He’s passionate about everything Android, likes to experiment with new tools and libraries and writes about his experiences in a personal blog.

speaker: Taeho Kim
title: Kotlin Korea
subject: Why has Lezhin Comics left for Kotlin? (레진코믹스가 코틀린으로 간 까닭은?)
description: 레진코믹스 안드로이드 앱은 왜 코틀린을 쓰게 된 것일까요? 그 이유와 함께, 코틀린을 도입하면서 겪은 경험담과 팁을 공유합니다.

speaker: Brad Campbell
title: Auckland Android Community
subject: Kotlin and Android
description: Kotlin is a programming language that compiles to Java bytecode. Android Developers all over the world are adding Kotlin to their apps - come along to find out why!

speaker: Miloš Vasić
title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
subject: Basics of Kotlin: Working with collections, generics and delegates
description: Predavač Miloš Vasić će pričati o korišćenju Kotlin kolekcija i tome kako su kolekcije dizajnirane na nivou jezika. Pričaćemo još o Generics-ima, kao i šta su to Kotlin delegati i kako možete da ih upotrebimo sa ciljem da poboljšamo naše aplikacije

subject: Corda and Kotlin
description: We are pleased to bring you the seventeenth event of the Docklands.LJC; a group within the main London Java Community that focuses on the developer community in and around Docklands each month.

speaker: João Carvalho
title: Portugal Java User Group
subject: Kotlin, not your grandfather's Java
description:
The JVM ecosystem encompasses multiple programming languages with different flavors and different paradigms. Kotlin's approach is to be a pragmatic, un-intrusive and more modern language in which all Java programmers feel right at home.

In this talk I will introduce Kotlin: Its core principles, show the differences and similarities to Java, how to inter operate with Java code, and how you can become a more productive developer by using it.

speaker: Andrey Breslav
title: Toulouse Kotlin User Group
subject: kotlin1.1 - Jetbrains Live Event

speaker: 長澤太郎
title: 日本Kotlinユーザグループ
subject: Kotlin初心者向けハンズオン
description:
Kotlinの基本文法などは学んだけれど、さらにそれからもう一歩進みたいと思っている方は多くいらっしゃると思います。 そのような方々に簡単なアプリケーションを作ることを通して、Kotlinを普段使いのできる言語として選択肢に入れて頂けるようになればと思います。

また、ハンズオン中に出てくるKotlinの知識は、はじめの講義にて簡単に復習を致しますので、事前学習ですべてを理解していただく必要はありません。

speaker: Cristian Monforte
title: Freakend Games 2017
subject: Kotlin, from No To Yes
description: Después de votar NO al uso de kotlin en mi equipo, la democracia ganó y se decidió empezar a usar kotlin en producción. Ese día decidí escribir todas las razones por la que voté No, para meses más tarde leerlas otra vez pero con más conocimiento.

speaker: Sergejs Luhmirins
title: GDG Riga
subject: What’s new in kotlin1.1?
description: Quick glance over major and the most exciting changes in newest Kotlin release with totally not made up real life examples. Type aliases, delegates, std-lib upgrades and much much more.

speaker: Toms Kusiņš
title: GDG Riga
subject: Kotlin in real life
description: Real life story of migrating a production app to Kotlin. Introduction on how we're using Kotlin in FullContact for Android. Insights you can apply when migrating to Kotlin yourself, and tips to make existing Kotlin code fun to write and easy to read.

speaker: Alexey Buzdin
title: GDG Riga
subject: KotlinJS - is it a thing?
description: What if you could write JavaScript in a good way? KotlinJS promises such a thing, but does it deliver? Let’s discuss.

subject: Desktop Programming in Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a statically typed language that targets the JVM and JavaScript developed by JetBrains. Tornado FX is a small and light JavaFX Framework for the Kotlin programming language. Come out for an introduction to Kotlin and TornadoFX. Learn how TornadoFX can help you build desktop applications on the JVM.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: Voxxed Days Athens
subject: Kotlin – Ready for production
description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

speaker: Akinori Yamada
title: Japan Java User Group
subject: Spark Framework with Kotlin
description: サイバーエージェントの競馬評論家であり、業務の傍らで「FRESH!」という生放送プラットフォームを作っています。よくAWSやDockerと戯れています。

speaker: Toshiaki Maki
title: Japan Java User Group
subject: Spring ❤️ Kotlin
description:
Spring BootでKotlinプログラミングを始める方法と、Spring Framework 5でのKotlin対応について紹介します。

時間があれば、Spring 5の新機能Router FunctionsをKotlinで書く方法についてもチラッとお見せします。

speaker: Christina Lee
title: Droidcon Italy 2017
subject: Kotlin: A Followup
description:
Intro

— recap basics of why kotlin vs Java

— recap interop

Roadblocks & Considerations

— team adoption

— integration of disparate skill sets (i.e. Java devs reviewing code for Kotlin devs and vice versa)

— precedents for when and how to use

— getting buy in from with executives and tech leads

— recruiting and hiring considerations

— updating release processes to accomodate hybrid codebase

— tooling failures and incompatabilites

— linters and style guides

— separation of concerns: language choice versus architectural decision (i.e. MVP can be done in Java or Kotlin, but doing it in Kotlin allows you to write it differently)

Conclusions:

— open questions we still have at Pinterest almost a year after introduction

— resources for devs looking to manage the political/organizational side of introducing a new language to a company

At this point in time, most Android developers have heard of Kotlin and are familiar with some of its advantages. In previous talks, I’ve covered why and how developers in large companies can attempt to introduce a new language, and all of it’s associated paradigims, into a legacy codebase. In this talk, we’ll cover some of the more advanced components of introducing a new language, including onboarding new team members, orchestrating team wide trainings, setting code and style guidelines, and adapting existing infrastructure tools to accept hybrid codebases. This talk aims to go beyond the why’s of adopting Kotlin and into the how’s of actually doing it, giving the developer a framework to use when thinking about adopting (or not) Kotlin into their own codebase.

speaker: Armando Picón
title: Droidcon Santo Domingo 2017
subject: Kotlin: A Followup
description: A workshop session where participants will learn about how to use kotlin to build android applications.

speaker: Giorgio Natili
title: Mobile Tea #14: Mobile and the City
subject: Functional Reactive Programming with Kotlin
description: Reactive programming is a paradigm oriented around data flows and propagation of changes. Kotlin is a programming language intended to be a better Java, and it's designed to be usable and readable across large teams with skill and discipline variances. Despite its object-oriented building blocks, Kotlin fits well in the functional reactive programming landscape. In this essay, I will deep-dive into the most relevant aspects of FRP in Kotlin focusing on the advantages that everyone can get when using this approach to build an Android app.

description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

This talk will present an introduction to Kotlin for Scala programmers.

speaker: Leonid Rudenko
title: Selenium Camp
subject: Excuse me, sir, do you have a moment to talk about tests in Kotlin?
description:
Do you remember why your tests are written in language X? Because the project is being developed in language X? It was teamlead’s decision? Do you know good libraries and tools for language X? Maybe it’s time to try to write tests in language Y?

Yes, the tests’ language may differ from the project’s language. And if you are using Java, there are reasons why your tests’ language can be Kotlin. Don’t be afraid, Kotlin is not a rocket science. I’ll tell you how the features of this language make it possible to spend less time on the tests’ support. How strong typing can be similar to the dynamic one. And why your favorite libraries will stay with you. And, of course, the main thing – how to start. Where possible, a comparison with Java and Groovy will be made.

If you do test automation or you develop in Java/Groovy – come to my talk.

speaker: Dirk Dittert
description: Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Programmiersprache für die Java VM, die sich für eine Vielzahl von Einsatzmöglichkeiten eignet  von der AndroidEntwicklung bis zum Gradle-Build-Skript. Für den Build Master lohnt es sich, einen Blick auf die Sprache zu werfen, da die täglichen Werkzeuge seit kurzem Kotlin unterstützen: Gradle 3 ermöglicht die Erstellung von Build-Skripten in Kotlin statt wie bisher in Groovy, wodurch z.B. wesentlich bessere Code-Vervollständigung in der IDE möglich wird. Aber auch Build-Konfigurationen für TeamCity können direkt mit Kotlin programmiert und in der Versionsverwaltung abgelegt werden.

subject: Curso presencial: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
title: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
speaker: Antonio Leiva
description:
¡NUEVA EDICIÓN DEL CURSO PRESENCIAL!

Aprende a crear una aplicación con Kotlin en un día.

El único curso especializado para aprender Kotlin desde cero mientras desarrollas una aplicación Android

En una jornada intensiva interiorizarás todos los conceptos del lenguaje necesarios para crear una app en Android.

Puede que la idea de aprender un lenguaje nuevo te haga pensar que vas a tener que dedicar demasiadas horas a analizar y escribir código hasta dominarlo con un experto. Puede que te preguntes si merecerá la pena el esfuerzo.
Sin embargo, el caso de Kotlin es diferente. Es tan sencillo que un curso intensivo de un día es suficiente para conocer todos los conceptos que necesitas para crear tu primera app utilizando Kotlin como lenguaje principal. Te lo garantizo. Es así porque Kotlin ha sido ideado para facilitar la transición desde Java.
El tiempo que dediques a aprender el lenguaje será tiempo que ganarás en el desarrollo diario de tus proyectos utilizando Kotlin.
Porque los nuevos conceptos que introduce Kotlin te ahorrarán líneas de código innecesarias y te darán soluciones impensables con Java a día de hoy.


Las compañías tecnológicas ya han empezado a utilizar Kotlin para desarrollar sus aplicaciones porque es un lenguaje maduro, que se integra a la perfección con Android Studio, es estable y seguro.
Dominarlo te permitirá situarte a la vanguardia en el desarrollo de apps Android. Cuando la demanda sea masiva estarás preparado para aprovechar las oportunidades profesionales.

Con Kotlin for Android Developers aprenderás en un día:

- A crear una App desde cero utilizando Kotlin: Todos los conceptos básicos necesarios para crear una app.

- A aplicar el lenguaje a Android: Las características exclusivas para Android y la interacción con el framework.

- A utilizar las herramientas de desarrollo: Aprenderás a integrar Kotlin en Android Studio y a utilizarlo en tus proyectos.

- De forma cien por cien práctica: A partir de ejemplos y escribiendo código.

- En un grupo reducido: Seremos un máximo de 15 personas, para poder dedicarte tiempo individualizado.

REQUISITOS: Fluidez con el Framework de Android y portátil propio con la última versión estable de Android Studio.

El acceso al curso presencial incluye nueve horas intensivas de formación presencial en las que aprenderás a crear una App con Kotlin desde cero.

Y además recibirás de forma gratuita…

- El libro en papel Kotlin for Android Developers (in inglés) (29€)
- Soporte por email durante un mes (97€)
- Acceso a mi comunidad privada de desarrolladores de Facebook (97€)
- El curso online Superpoderes para convertirte en un Desarrollador de Éxito (47€)

Me llamo Antonio Leiva, soy Android Engineer.

Desde que descubrí Kotlin en 2015 me he dedicado a exprimirlo al máximo para volcar todo su potencial en el desarrollo de aplicaciones para Android.

Mi objetivo con este curso es trasladarte esos conocimientos, mostrarte cómo utilizar Kotlin en un entorno Android en nueve horas de formación intensiva para que puedas mejorar tu productividad, saltar los límites de otros lenguajes y destacar como desarrollador aplicando un código moderno, sencillo y funcional.

Más información: https://devexperto.com/kotlin-desarrolladores-android-presencial/

subject: Kotlin en Acción
title: Kotlin en Acción para Android Developers
speaker: Armando Picon, Lima Perú
description: Este taller está diseñado para introducir a los desarrolladores android en el uso de este lenguaje de programación. Se hará un repaso de los conceptos básicos del lenguaje y cómo estos pueden aplicarse en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android.

subject: Kotlin: Customer Review
title: Functional Miners - 02.2017
speaker: Mateusz Sulima
description: Chciałbym przedstawić mocne i słabe strony Kotlina zauważone po pół roku korzystania na produkcji. Szczególnie skupię się na porównaniu do jego bliskich krewnych - Javy i Scali.

subject: Java 6++: Moderne Android-Entwicklung mit Kotlin
title: JavaLand 2017
speaker: Benjamin Schmid
description:
Android-Entwickler können nur sehnsüchtig seufzen: Die neuen Möglichkeiten aus Java 8 wie funktionale Programmierung, Lambdas oder Streams bleiben ihnen noch vorenthalten. Grund: Die Android-Plattform steckt weitgehend noch auf Java 6 fest. Abhilfe schafft hier die JVM-Sprache Kotlin, die nach über fünf Jahren Entwicklung mittlerweile die stabile Version 1.0 erreicht hat. Kotlin verspricht nicht nur weniger Boilerplate Code dank einer ausdrucksstarken und gut lesbaren Syntax mit funktionalen Features. Nein - eine vollständige Binärkompatibilität mit Java 6, die nahtlose Interoperabilität mit bestehenden Java-Code und eine enge Integration in die Android Studio IDE machen Kotlin auch für die moderne Android-Entwicklung zu einer idealen Alternative.

In dieser Session erleben wir live, wie es sich anfühlt, der NullpointerException auf Nimmerwiedersehen zu sagen und sie in für die App-Entwicklung gegen funktionale Features, Dataclasses und Extension-Methods einzutauschen. Eine kleine Beispiel-App hilft beim Kennenlernen und vermittelt lebendige Eindrücke, sodass auch Android-Neulinge gut folgen können. Tools wie wie Anko und die Kotlin Android Extensions unterstützen beim Bändigen des Android SDK. Am Ende konnten wir hoffentlich nicht nur viel Lust und Inspiration auf eigene Experimente und Versuche anregen, sondern auch interessante Einblicke in die Programmiersprache sowie ihren Einsatz unter Android im Speziellen mitnehmen.

subject: Kotlin in Practice
title: JUG Saxony Camp Leipzig 2017
speaker: Philipp Hauer
description: We speak about the introduction of Kotlin at Spreadshirt and the experience we made with this great language. We show how the development with popular frameworks (like Spring, Jackson and Vaadin) can benefit from Kotlin.

subject: Let's go to discover Kotlin!
title: Devoxx France
speaker: David Wursteisen, Mounir Boudraa
description: Kotlin is between Java and Scala : more powerfull than Java with immutable class, extensions method, and other features, without be as complex as Scala. While building an interactive movie catalogues, discover with us major Kotlin features, Java integration, how Kotlin can be a productive language and how it help you to be more productive.

subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
title: ACCU 2017
speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
description:
Kotlin is a new programming language for the JVM (and JavaScript VM) by JetBrains. It is a statically typed language designed to include the most pragmatic features from Java, Groovy, C# and Scala. Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been in an ideal world.

This session is an overview of Kotlin features using code examples and comparison with other JVM languages. The idea is to move from compiling and running "hello world" to more advanced examples, encounter some Kotlin puzzlers along the way and finish with actual program written in Kotlin (most likely Snake game).

subject: 解剖 Kotlin ~バイトコードを読み解く~
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: Toshihiro Yagi
description: Kotlinの特徴的な機能としてnull許容型や関数型や拡張関数などがよく取り沙汰されます。null安全だとか高階関数で簡潔に記述だとか拡張関数便利最高といった話は枚挙に暇がありません。確かに言語機能としていろいろとJavaに比べて便利なのは分かるんだけど、でもまぁ別にJavaを使っていてクリティカルに困っているわけではないしな〜学習コストとかチームへの導入コストを考えるとそこまで旨味を感じられるわけでもないしな〜みたいなそんな気分。わかります。 本セッションではKotlinのコードをコンパイルして得られるJavaバイトコードを、可読化したりデコンパイルする事によって、Kotlinの特徴的な言語機能がJavaでどのように表現されているかを読み解いていきます。これによりKotlinが肩代わりしてくれるボイラープレートコード群を明らかにします。Kotlinを使うことで省略できたボイラープレートコードが可読性をどのように高め、設計に影響を与えるのかについても言及します。 目次案

subject: Kotlin + RxJava + Dagger2 + Orma + Retrofit で作るAndroidアプリ
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: Aizawa lvla
description:
これらを利用したAndroidアプリケーションの作り方を紹介したいと思います。 目次(予定)

- 各ソフトウェア軽い紹介

- Kotlin?

- RxJava?

- Dagger2?

- Orma?

- Retrofit?

subject: Kotlinを始めようハンズオン
title: DroidKaigi 2017
speaker: 長澤太郎
description: 新しいプログラミング言語のKotlin（ことりん）を使ったAndroidプログラミングのハンズオンです。長らく（特に）Androidエンジニアの注目を集めていたKotlinですが、今年2月に念願のver1.0のリリースと7月に日本初の書籍の出版があり、今非常に勢いのある言語です。

subject: Monthly Kotlin users get-together
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
speaker: Bas Cancrinus
description: We're getting together in an informal setting to share our knowledge of Kotlin and catch up. Please step up when you're willing to present something you've done with Kotlin. Don't be shy :-)

subject: 【東京】JJUG ナイト・セミナー 「Kotlin（ことりん）
title: Japan Java User Group
speaker: 長澤 太郎
description:
ここ数年、注目を集めているJVM言語 Kotlin（ことりん）をテーマに開催します。 JJUGナイトセミナーとしてKotlinを取り上げるのは今回が初めて

Kotlinは、IntelliJ IDEAなどのIDEでおなじみのJetBrainsにより開発されているプログラミング言語です。 Java言語が動く環境を主要なターゲットとしており、その活躍の幅はサーバサイド、デスクトップ、モバイルなど多岐へ渡ります。 近日リリース予定のバージョン1.1やSpring frameworkのKotlinサポートなど、今ホットな言語であると言えるでしょう。

subject: Kotlin Talk
title: Android Developer Group Nürnberg
speaker: Nino Handler
description:
This time we will be talking about Kotlin. And I'm not talking about the Russian island and I won't either compare it to the Indonesian island Java, but talk about both as a language. I recently started learning Kotlin and my talk will introduce you to my first month with Kotlin, things I liked and things I really didn't understand.

I'm currently also trying to get a second speaker from the Kotlin community with more experience who might either substitute me or dive deeper into this language with us. In any case, there will be giveaways for Kotlin fans.

subject: Kotlin all the... tests!
title: Mobius conference
speaker: Danny Preussler
description: Kotlin was the rising star of programming languages in 2016. Not only did it get to version 1.0 but also got rapidly adopted in the Android community. But many companies are struggling to add Kotlin to an existing Java project. It's not easy to add a new language to an existing team. It's much easier to introduce Kotlin to your project using the backdoor: your unit tests. So let's look at Kotlin more from a testing perspective. How does writing tests in Kotlin look like, what possibilities of the language will help us?

subject: Kotlin - der neue Stern am Java Himmel?
title: Java User Group Hamburg
speaker: Dirk Dittert
description:
Schreiben Sie immer noch ellenlangen Boilerplate Code und stolpern in Ihren Projekten über Nullpointer Exceptions? Mit Kotlin gehört beides der Vergangenheit an! Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Sprache, die für die Entwicklung großer Projekte wie gemacht ist. Dabei besticht sie sowohl mit einer flachen Lernkurve als auch einer hervorragenden Kompatibilität zu bestehendem Java Code.

Gemeinsam unterziehen wir die kürzlich erschienene erste offizielle Version der Sprache einem Praxistest und lernen durch praxisnahe Codebeispiele die Unterschiede zu Java kennen. Ein Blick auf die verfügbaren Frameworks rundet den Vortrag ab. Ob Kotlin die Erwartungen erfüllen kann?

subject: Functional web applications avec Kotlin and Spring
title: Toulouse Java User Group
speaker: Davin Kevin
description: This presentation made by Sebastien Deleuze will show you a new type of functional application using Spring Reactive and Kotlin. This language fits well for Object and Functional programmation and is very well integrated in Spring stack.

subject: Meetup #2
title: Kotlin Rio
speaker: Lucas Albuquerque
description: Kotlin Live Coding (& Dojo)

subject: Kotlin for Android: The future is now
title: KotlinMAD
speaker: Antonio Leiva
description: Kotlin has come to stay, and it's the perfect time to start using it. Are you bored programming with Java on Android? Tired of seeing how your code is full of NullPointerException? Tired of not being able to use the latest features in modern languages? Thanks to Kotlin, we have a new world of possibilities ahead, hard to imagine until now in Android App development. In this talk we'll see how Kotlin makes interaction with the Android framework easier, how it reduces the complexity of the code and improves its readability, making our apps more robust and maintainable.

subject: Kotlin @PeakGames
title: Javaday Istanbul
speaker: ilkin Balkanay
description: We have 5 successful Android games written in Java programming language. We constantly add new features to these games and we will continue adding new features to them over the next 5 years. Although, we love the Java programming language, we have decided to develop new features in our games using the Kotlin programming language, a modern and pragmatic language. In this presentation you will learn why Kotlin becomes a worthwhile programming language, what the process of learning the language is, and how we solve the problems encountered when adding new features to the existing games with Kotlin.

subject: Kotlin vs Swift
title: Monkey Tech Days
speaker: Emmanuel Vinas
description: That event is a workshop where people will discover differences between Kotlin and swift mainly for non mobile development. It is organized with the GDG Toulouse.

subject: Future of Kotlin: Strategy and Tactics
title: JPoint
speaker: Andrey Breslav
description: A successful project usually grows, and Kotlin is no exception. We are adding new targets (JavaScript and Native) and new computation models (coroutines). This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?

subject: Kotlin Puzzlers
title: JPoint
speaker: Anton Keks
description: Kotlin is a marvelous alternative language for the JVM, aiming to improve usability of aging Java. While not exactly new, it has been quickly gaining adoption since its 1.0 release in 2016. Anton will give a brief introduction and present Puzzlers of Kotlin — the gotchas that you may encounter while digging deeper into the language. While Kotlin was in development for 6 years, and aimed to be a perfect practical language, like all other languages, it still has tricky parts that you don't find in the documentation.

subject: The Future of Kotlin: How agile can language development be?
title: Mix-IT
speaker: Andrey Breslav
description: A successful project usually grows, and Kotlin is no exception. We are adding new targets (JavaScript and Native) and new computation models (coroutines). This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?.

subject: Kotlin all your tests
title: Сodefest
speaker: JDanny Preussler
description: 2 Kotlin was the rising star of programming languages in 2016. It not only became final with version 1.0 but also got rapidly adopted in the android community. But many companies are struggling to add Kotlin to an existing Java project. It's not easy to add a new language to an existing team. But it's much easier to introduce Kotlin to your project using the backdoor: your unit tests. So let's look at Kotlin more from a testing perspective. How does it look like to write tests in Kotlin, what possibilities of the language will help us?

title: CADEC - CALLISTA DEVELOPER'S CONFERENCE 2017
speaker: Jesper Holmberg
description: 201General presentation of the Kotlin language, and how it fits within the JVM eco system.

title: Warsaw Cloud Native Meetup

This reference web application we are going to see in detail has be developed with the following principles

title: Kotlin Night in Warsaw
